title: Projects
section: Project 2: Framing Deregulation in Trump’s Environmnetal Executive Orders and Speeches
text:
Project 2: Framing Deregulation in Trump’s Environmnetal Executive Orders and Speeches
Following Donald Trump’s presidential inauguration in early 2025, his public speeches and released executive orders on enviromental matters from 2017 to 2025 were examined to see how the language of the Trump administration frames energy, climate, and regulatory priorities. Within R, dictionary based text as data approaches were utilized to reveal patterns in energy and environment topics. The results demonstrated a pattern of dominate language around the development of fossil fuel while collaterally sacrificing environmental protection.
View Project Here

title: About Me
text:
Hello! My name is Astrid Van Haren. I am currently studying data analytics and computational social science at the University of Massachusetts Amherst.
Outside of school, I enjoy hiking, reading, and spending time on arts and crafts.


My goals for the next few years include:
Strengthening my ability to analyze complex data, become proficient in statistical programming, and gain exposure to the sector of public health.
Additionally, I am most intersted in working with projects that emphasize epidemology and biostatistics. In these domains, I aspire to use analytical and related tools to help inform decision-making of concerns in public health.



Bachelors of Arts, Psychology, University of Massachusetts Lowell
Relevant Coursework: Biostatistics, Research Methods, Biology I

Thanks for checking out my web site!
